DOCNAME: CASE OF DIKA v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village PERSON , PERSON , the former GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a Fokker airplane , which was operated by the NORP company ORG ( “ the first defendant ” ) , crashed at GPE airport during taking off . The applicant was one of the few passengers who survived the accident . He sustained serious physical injuries .
CARDINAL . Settlement negotiations between the applicant , the ORG , ORG ( “ the second defendant ” ) , ORG from the GPE and ORG of GPE were unsuccessful .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant brought a civil action before ORG ( GPE суд GPE I GPE ) requesting the court to award him compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary loss sustained as a result of the accident : in particular , he asked the court to order the defendants to compensate him for the loss of his personal belongings , medical expenses , his loss of income and loss for his mental suffering , as well as to pay him a life - time pension given his permanent incapacity .
CARDINAL . The first hearing was held on DATE and was attended by all parties . It was adjourned on the request of the applicant to allow him to submit additional evidence .
CARDINAL . The hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned due to the applicant 's illness .
CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE , the court provided the defendants with evidence previously submitted by the applicant .

CARDINAL . The next hearing of DATE was rescheduled on the defendants ' request for further time to examine the applicant 's submissions . Meanwhile , the applicant changed lawyers . At the hearing of CARDINAL DATE , the court ordered CARDINAL of the defendants to provide further evidence .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE , the court ordered a forensic expert examination to establish the applicant 's loss of income given that he had a work permit in GPE .
CARDINAL . Hearings scheduled for DATE and DATE were adjourned as the parties had not been properly summoned .
CARDINAL . At a hearing of DATE the applicant had requested an adjournment to allow him to further particularise his claim .
CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE , CARDINAL of the defendants requested a postponement to examine the applicant 's more recent submissions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court adjourned the hearing : there was no evidence that the forensic expert and the first defendant had been properly summoned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court heard the expert . The court further ordered the applicant to further particularise his financial claim and to provide information about a sum of money he had already received from the first defendant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the Minister of ORG to intervene before the competent court for a speedy resolution of his case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained before the President of ORG that no decision had been taken although all relevant evidence and expert opinions had been obtained . On DATE he repeated his grievances before the President of ORG .
CARDINAL . Adjournments of hearings fixed for DATE and CARDINAL DATE were afforded in the absence of evidence that the first defendant had been properly summoned .
CARDINAL . A hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned on the parties ' request , as they were pursuing an out - of - court settlement .
CARDINAL . A hearing held on CARDINAL DATE was postponed as the first defendant had withdrawn from the case .

CARDINAL . Hearings fixed for DATE , DATE and DATE were adjourned again due to a lack of evidence that the first defendant had been properly summoned . The court record stated that the slip of the mail receipt had borne the signature , but not the stamp , of the first defendant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested to be exempted from court fees .

CARDINAL . The court adjourned a hearing fixed for DATE as the applicant had failed to provide evidence supporting his request for exemption . Hearings fixed for DATE , DATE and DATE were adjourned due to improper delivery of the court summons on the first defendant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to declare it incompetent ratione loci and to confer the further handling of his case on ORG . He maintained that , because of his poor financial situation , he could not sustain the travelling expenses from his place of residence to GPE to attend the court hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant 's request as out of time . By a decision of CARDINAL September CARDINAL ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request to transfer his case to another court competent ratione materiae : his arguments , that the proceedings had lasted DATE and that he had scarce means of subsistence , could not be regarded as sufficient to justify that measure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained before ORG about the delays in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . A hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned as none of the parties appeared at court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested a special delivery of the court summons on the first defendant .

CARDINAL . The court adjourned a hearing fixed for DATE , in the parties ' presence , to allow it examine the first defendant 's legal status and the validity of the letter of authority of its lawyer . The court also undertook to secure information as to whether the first defendant had been insolvent .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court was informed that preliminary bankruptcy proceedings had been instituted against the first defendant . As that information did not reach the court in time , it adjourned a hearing fixed for DATE . The court decided to summon the first applicant 's receiver for the next hearing .

CARDINAL . The hearings fixed for DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE were adjourned due to improper delivery of the court summons on the first defendant or the receiver . The applicant proposed that a further summons for the first defendant be announced on the court 's notice board .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court was notified that the preliminary bankruptcy proceedings against the first defendant had been suspended . The court adjourned a hearing fixed for DATE to confirm the validity of the letter of authority of the first defendant 's lawyer .
CARDINAL . The court then adjourned a hearing of DATE as the first defendant had not been properly summoned . In response to the applicant 's request , it fixed the next hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG partly upheld the applicant 's claim and ordered the first defendant to pay just compensation for his non - pecuniary loss and for his pecuniary loss from DATE until DATE . It dismissed the remainder of his claim against the first defendant . The court further dismissed his claim against the second defendant given the latter 's lack of legal capacity ( немање на пасивна легитимација ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal and upheld the trial court 's decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant had CARDINAL different representatives during these proceedings .

CARDINAL . LAW ( ORG за парничната постапка ) ( “ the Act ” ) provided , at the relevant time , that it was incumbent upon the court to undertake to conduct the proceedings without undue delay and economically , and to inhibit any attempt of abuse of the rights afforded to the parties concerned .
